Venue.definition: the place or county in which take place the alleged events from which a legal action arises used esp. at common law 2
Venue.origin: [Anglo-French, place where a jury is summoned, alteration (influenced by venue arrival, attendance) of vinné visné , literally, neighborhood, neighbors, from Old French, ultimately from Latin vicinus neighboring]

1.definition: the place or county in which take place the alleged events from which a legal action arises used esp. at common law

2.definition: the place from which a jury is drawn and in which trial is held see alsocompare

3.definition: a statement showing that a case is brought to the proper court or authority
